intro: Lecythis lurida, commonly known as the red lecythium, is a tropical tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The tree produces a heavy, oily fruit that contains a single large seed surrounded by a sticky, aromatic pulp. Its bark and leaves have been used in traditional medicine for their potential anti-inflammatory and antiseptic properties. The plant is also valued for its durable wood and role in local ecosystems.
